message: Hello Bob! I'm excited to offer you this incredible product that I think you'll love. It's a unique opportunity to get your hands on something truly special. I'm willing to sell it to you for $12000. What do you think?
Thank you for the offer, Alice. I appreciate the uniqueness of the product, but I'm looking to keep my investment within a certain budget. Would you consider selling it for $10000?
Thank you for your offer, Bob. I appreciate your interest in the product. However, I'm willing to meet you halfway. I'm willing to sell it to you for $11500. What do you think?
I'm glad you're willing to meet me halfway, Alice. Considering my budget, could you possibly lower the price to $10500?
I understand you're trying to stay within your budget, Bob. I'm willing to make another concession. I can sell the product to you for $11000. This is as low as I can go. What do you think?
Thank you for your flexibility, Alice. Given your last offer, I would like to propose $10750 as my final offer.

I appreciate your persistence, Bob. However, I'm not willing to go any lower than $11000. I'm willing to throw in some extras to sweeten the deal. I'll include a premium service package worth $500, which will make the total value of the deal $11500. What do you think?
I appreciate the additional value you're offering, Alice. Considering that, I would like to propose $11250 as my final offer.

I understand you're close to your budget, Bob. I'm willing to make one more concession. I'll throw in an additional service worth $250, making the total value of the deal $11250. However, I'm not willing to go any lower. This is my final offer. What do you think?
